title: misconfigured CORS let to HPP and SOP bypass
content:
Hello team,
I found a bug on your website that let me bypass the SOP policy.
Hope you fix it, everything is in the video
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PYsU350S-s4
Impact
The attacker my direct a victim to a phishing page of www.bitterrent.com/login and he/she will be convince to enter their email and password or even hijack csrf-token and sending him a password or email reset link.
I also found a link that expose the csrf-token on the URL and you should check this link in the black.svg host header URL
steps: Identify a misconfigured CORS policy on the target website (www.bitterrent.com).
Exploit the misconfigured CORS to bypass Same-Origin Policy (SOP) and perform HTTP Parameter Pollution (HPP).
Craft a phishing page mimicking www.bitterrent.com/login to capture user credentials or CSRF tokens.
Use the exposed CSRF token from the black.svg host header URL to hijack user sessions or perform unauthorized actions.
vuln_description: The vulnerability involves a misconfigured CORS policy that allows attackers to bypass SOP and perform HPP. This can lead to phishing attacks where victims are tricked into entering their credentials on a fake login page. Additionally, the exposure of CSRF tokens in URLs further exacerbates the risk by enabling session hijacking or unauthorized actions.
reason: The attack requires understanding and exploiting multiple components (CORS misconfiguration, SOP bypass, HPP, CSRF token exposure) and their interactions. However, these are well-documented attack vectors, and the steps to exploit them are relatively straightforward once the misconfiguration is identified.
